meanings.definition: Stand or wait around without apparent purpose.
meanings.sent1: The students like to loiter outside the school after classes.
meanings.sent2: Don't loiter in the hallway, please keep moving.
meanings.sent3: Why do you always loiter near the vending machine? Are you waiting for it to give out free snacks?
meanings.sent4: She seemed to loiter in time, as if the world around her moved faster than she did.
meanings.sent5: The detective watched the suspect loiter near the crime scene, waiting for a slip-up.

meanings.sent1: The cat likes to loiter around the house, taking its time to explore.
meanings.sent2: The old dog would loiter in the sun, enjoying the warmth on its fur.
meanings.sent3: The sloth would loiter along the tree branches, never in a hurry to get anywhere.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to loiter on that lazy Sunday afternoon, stretching out endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The clouds loitered in the sky, drifting aimlessly with no destination.

meanings.sent1: Teenagers often loiter at the mall, not really shopping but just hanging out.
meanings.sent2: I tend to loiter in the park on weekends, enjoying the fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The cat would loiter around the house, not doing much except napping and eating.
meanings.sent4: Thoughts would loiter in his mind, drifting from one idea to another without focus.
meanings.sent5: The memories of childhood loitered in her mind, bringing a sense of nostalgia.
